Reviews.Title: Not a lot of other choices out there
Reviews.Author: listenswithwolves
Reviews.Content: I bought this stand for my home gym. It was the only one I could find ata decent price that was also tall enough to be seen over my ellipticaltrainer. It is a very solidly made stand, but not very well designed.1st drawback: Nearly the entire thing is put together with tiny setscrews (a dozen in all) that you must tighten with a tiny allen wrench.This makes height adjustments quite a pain. Peerless really should haveat least put a thumb screw at the height adjustment pipe. To workaroundthis, I found an adjustable hose clamp with a built in plasticthumbscrew at the 99cent store, and it works great.2nd drawback: There is no up/down angle adjustment where the tv ismounted, so it must always stay basically flat perpendicular to thefloor. Adding this feature would probably have added somewhat to theprice, but I would have gladly paid for it.Other than these two issues, this is a solid and pretty nice-lookingstand which can also hide your cables pretty well.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for the home workout room
Reviews.Author: E. Helmuth
Reviews.Content: Bought this stand for mounting a 26" LCD television high enough to see it on the exercise bike in the basement workout room. It works great, and would be fine for a treadmill or other equipment. It is very well made and very easy to assemble with clear instructions. The price seemed high to me until I received it - the materials and machining are top quality. Before you buy it, though, be sure that your TV has a VESA 75 or 100 mounting pattern (hole spacing for the mounting plate screws). The LG televisions on Amazon list the VESA mounting patterns in the PDF spec sheet; for other manufacturers you may have download a product manual on the manufacturer's website and go to the wall mounting section for this info. Most but not all  TV's under 30" use VESA 75 or 100.

Reviews.Title: Nice Stand for the Smaller monitor/tv
Reviews.Author: Ace
Reviews.Content: This stand works great depending on what you are trying to use it for.I actually called up Peerless and got an adapter so that the VESA could expand to 200x200 (this allows for larger tv's to be mounted).When screwed into the floor OR with heavy weights on the legs/stand holding it down, I have actually mount a 47" on it with the VESA Adapter Plate sold seperatley. The TV was less than the 40lb weight limit.I also went to home depot and purchased different screws for the assembly of it to add extra security.I have dealt with lots of Floor stands before and this one does the job people.  Just make sure you are using it properly and are buying it for the right purpose.  It will easily mount a TV/Monitor up to roughly 28" (as long as the VESA is 100x100), without any extra purchases or equipment.  If you want to knock it down, you can.....its not the heaviest thing in the world.  It literally weighs 25lbs.I like it.

Reviews.Title: A good stand with an achilles heal
Reviews.Author: joelifer "joelifer"
Reviews.Content: The stand appeared to be exactly what I wanted. The numerous socket set screws were really no big deal.There is minimal wobble, but nothing of concern. HOWEVER, if you do not plan to bolt this to the floor or to something likea 3/4th " plywood board, be prepaired for some significant bending of the frame at the base and ultimately ALOT of wobbling.I had to jerry-rig a 1/2" square aluminum pipe under the base and place 4 felt base threaded stem glides threw the squarepipe and the frame of this stand to give it enough structure integrity so that it could remain free standing and stable.Given the price, I still think it was a worthwhile product- but needs some minimal design help.

Reviews.Title: Decent option, but not great engineering
Reviews.Author: R. M. Fleming
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to like this item -- it was for a dorm room that didn't allow a wall mount. We mounted a 32" tv that was well within the weight limits. It performed very nicely. But the tubing is really a lot thicker than it looks in the pictures. It's very sturdy construction, so you know it will hold. But the hex screws seem kind of chintzy -- couldn't they use thumb screws or something more accessible? The bottom cross tube is very thick and the picture hides the length of the feet extending out the back of the tube (4" or more).Maybe my use wasn't ever intended, but I think with a little industrial design, this would be an awesome alternative to a wall mount. It's adequate now but has potential.

Reviews.Title: Good basic stand
Reviews.Author: L. Cotterman
Reviews.Content: This is a good basic stand. It has great height and it fairly stable. It takes some fiddling to get set up because it has these tiny set screws which require a tiny allen wrench to tighten. Would be much improved with some thumb screws.

Reviews.Title: VGA Cable Do Not Fit
Reviews.Author: Timothy A. Neighbors
Reviews.Content: This product is structurally well designed, however, the internal diameter of the upper pole that attaches to the monitor is 1.25 inches, which is less than the width of any VGA cable we have been able to find to this point.  So, there is no way to utilize the cable management hole that is provided when using a VGA cable; since this is a monitor stand, it would seem important.  Its as if the manufacturer never actually fully tested their design.  I contacted the manufacturer and asked them to recommend a VGA cable for use. The responded with the following:"Thank you for contacting Peerless Industries.  I contacted our engineering team and after testing with the cables, it has been found that the VGA cable will not work with this.  The tubing is not large enough to accommodate the plug."So I would only recommend this product if you plan on having your vga cable exposed.

Reviews.Title: Good stand for Treadmills
Reviews.Author: THD
Reviews.Content: The display stand is being used with a True treadmill with the addition of a custom made mouse/keyboard tray so my wife can walk while working on her computer. The stand is good and well made. The only drawbacks are that the holes for the cable are not big enough for VGA (they're fine for HDMI), the ability to adjust it is limited, and the way my monitor attaches required me to slightly cut the VGA cable connector.I also noted that when walking on the treadmill, the monitor oscillates slightly, but this is probably due to the base being on a carpet and under the front of the treadmill. I'm trying to figure out a way to stop this. My wife hasn't complained about it - just an observation I made.If you're thinking of adding a monitor or TV to a treadmill or elliptical, it's probably a very good choice.

Reviews.Title: Simple solution, Great price.
Reviews.Author: Daniel Wiersma
Reviews.Content: An inexpensive alternative to drilling holes in my 'stand-up' desk ..... this get's the job done nicely - - - for only $125.00!

Reviews.Title: Perfect for treadmill, paired with LED TV & Roku stick
Reviews.Author: JBinDC
Reviews.Content: See picture.  I used this stand to mount a Samsung UN19F4000 19-Inch LED TV in front of my treadmill and plugged in a Roku stick for wireless streaming.  I adjusted the height of the stand so that the TV is in the middle of my line of sight when I'm on the treadmill (I'm 5'10").  The prongs in the front of the stand fit under the front of my treadmill, so I could bring it in close.  There are holes at the top and bottom to hide cables but if your TV power cord has an adapter box (like mine does) you may not be able to hide it.The stand is well made, very sturdy, I'm sure it could support a much larger TV.  The only criticism I have is that the threading in the drilled holes isn't always precise and it took a while to line up the little screws that hold it together, but overall the assembly is not complicated and once the screws are in the whole stand can be adjusted with the included allen wrench.  I'm  very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for Trade Shows
Reviews.Author: Albert K.
Reviews.Content: I bought this for demoing our software at trade shows.  Easy to set up, solid construction and looks great.  I highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: Nice stand.
Reviews.Author: Robert Schnell
Reviews.Content: The stand is adjustable for my needs in front of my treadmill. I had to screw it to the floor for stability. Nice product.

Reviews.Title: Seems to do the job ok.
Reviews.Author: Raj
Reviews.Content: As others have pointed out the whole stand is held up by 12 very small screws. These also provide structural support. So that is one concern for me. I also hoped it would slide under the treadmill, but no luck. Maybe that is intentional so that the stand won't mess with the motor, etc.Overall i am kinda satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Works for Me
Reviews.Author: Miss Maura
Reviews.Content: I have an antique desk with funky drawers and shelves that I wanted to spare the weight of a monitor. So I bought this. It is heavy, solid piping. As a matter of fact, there is one length of pipe I didn't need (to make it shorter), and I keep it by my bed in case of an intruder. It should support any monitor you attach to it. And the cords can be hidden within the pipe for a clean look.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for a treadmill
Reviews.Author: Michael M. Murray "txag"
Reviews.Content: Now I have no excuse for not exercising. The TV is right in my line of sight and is held steady by this stand.

Reviews.Title: One stout stand!!
Reviews.Author: Jered
Reviews.Content: This stand is much larger and heavier than it looks in the pictures. It's stout and strong and no complaints at all. Perfect for in front of a treadmill!

Reviews.Title: Works fine.
Reviews.Author: Engineer
Reviews.Content: Good quality, simple design. It is held together with set screws but they are more than adequate for the task. They recommend bolting to the floor - for my 24" tv I found that unnecessary.  I did add some rubber pads to the base to keep from scratching the floor.  The base slides easily under my treadmill and provides a very stable platform for my application.

Reviews.Title: Great for Price, scratch easily
Reviews.Author: RCR_CT
Reviews.Content: We purchased a pair of these to use during conferences.  We mounted a 26" LCD to it.  It was very stable, and we had no problems with it falling over (or even pretending to fall over).  It is easy to put together, but be careful, the black paint scratches easily.  We had to route the cables on the outside of the pipe as the VGA cable and power-cord would not fit into the pipe. If you are looking for a low-cost solution to mounting an LCD up high, this is it.

Reviews.Title: Great idea!
Reviews.Author: Bethany
Reviews.Content: This TV stand is perfect for areas where a shelved stand will not fit in the room. Just bought this for my college student's dorm room.....fits great between the two desks. The only problem I have with the stand is that it only accommodates Flat TV sizes 30 in. or less. We thought that a 32 in. would fit since 30 in. TVs are not made; wrong....the holes on the mounting plate do not match up with the holes on the back of the TV.  Why did they not make the stand for a 32 in. TV or less because of the fact that 30 in. TV are not made.

Reviews.Title: Kind of cheap
Reviews.Author: Video guy
Reviews.Content: Not made well. Hard and confusing to put together and when it is built I stepped back and thought, "is this going to hold my monitor without breaking.  Not a very comforting feeling.  I should sell mine.

Reviews.Title: Works great...
Reviews.Author: Andrew
Reviews.Content: Works great and somewhat easy to set up but don't plan on having something that is even close to being portable. This thing weighs a ton but is very steady and is great for somebody who needs a stationary monitor stand.

Reviews.Title: CNS not a good vendor
Reviews.Author: Ron F. Spector "Ron S."
Reviews.Content: First off sent the wrong product.  No problem getting a RMA. Returned the item and vendor sent me an email saying the credit would be posted to my account within 10 days.  Two months later and still no credit.  Had to take more time disputing the charge with my credit card! Complete waste of my time!

Reviews.Title: The three legs are unstable so the speakers fall on the floor all the time!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: The reason chairs have 4 and sometimes 5 legs is to provide you with a sturdy platform for your body. This is supposed to hold up your precious speakers, but it only has 3 legs, so it is unstable in all situations. Bump it and it will go down, possibly to kill that speaker, and possibly to mar your furniture if it was in the way.BTW, it is worse the heavier the speaker, because that makes it top-heavy.
